[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v2/Headlines.png[/img]
[b][i]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1999047]Vitani[/url][/i][/b][/align]

[b][color=white]Lucky Clover awards[/color][/b]
The three clover awards have been around for a while, but until now it was unknown what their purpose was. Omniscient has revealed that everyone has a chance to win it with each post that exceeds 100 characters. [i][size=x-small]
The chances to win the awards are:
Green Clover - 1 in 2,000    [img]http://hackforums.net/uploads/awards/green-shamrock.png[/img]
Purple Clover - 1 in 12,500  [img]http://hackforums.net/uploads/awards/purple-shamrock.png[/img]
Gold Clover - 1 in 50,000    [img]http://hackforums.net/uploads/awards/gold-shamrock.png[/img][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5291481] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v2/NotableThreads.png[/img][/align]
[align=center][b][i]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1221196]King Cin[/url][/i][/b][/align]

[b][color=white][u]Announcement Threads[/u][/color][/b]

Supreme leader of Hack Forums, Omniscient, has not created any announcement threads this week.

[b][color=white][u]Informational Threads[/u][/color][/b]

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5297201][b]Why you're not ready for your dream girl[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2308580][color=#EFEFEF][b]Black Flash ⚡[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color] If you want to hear the cold truth about why you're not ready for the girl of your dreams, or potentially even the guy of your dreams, this thread will help you a lot. A lot of people keep waiting their entire lives without taking action and blame their own misfortune on the circumstances, but this will be a paradigm shift for some of you.

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5298227][b]Care less for more girls[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1221196][color=#EFEFEF][b]King Cin[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color] I created a thread where I talk about something that will make you (appear) less needy when interacting with the opposite sex. It's not really something that's easy to summarize since the thread isn't that long to begin with. If you're really interested you'll take a look anyways. 

[b][color=white][u]Entertaining Threads[/u][/color][/b] 

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4747490][b]Why does no one on HF have a fashion sense?[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=672755][color=#00AAFF][b]Saint Laurent Paris[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]The member Saint Laurent Paris is convinced that people on Hack Forums have no sense of fashion. If you want to prove him wrong you should definitely post on his thread to show him the Yeezy Boost 750's you bought this weekend. But seriously, let him know that people on HF are capable of dressing themselves well!

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5297054][b]Hackforums From 2007 - Today ~ Screenshots // The Clover Edition[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2061024][color=#EFEFEF][b]Raymond Reddington[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Raymond Reddington has created a thread in which you can see how Hack Forums has changed over the course of several years. If you haven't been on the site for long this will be something that's very fun to see. If you're an older member this thread is bound to make you feel nostalgic since you can look at the old school theme again. Great times.

[b][color=white][u]Contests and Giveaways[/u][/color][/b] 

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5260432][b][Eternal] Never Ending Giveaway | Open to all | Bitcoin | Awards[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1960790][color=#EFEFEF][b]Errors[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Errors will be giving away at least two prizes each month in the name of Eternal. If you want free stuff or are in dire need of financial aid, check this thread out.

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5301830][b][The Order] Legalize It Award Giveaway[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1165241][color=#EFEFEF][b]Krave[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Krave is giving away the 'Legalize It' award to one lucky member. The contest has some requirements that your profile must meet in order to be eligible for the award, but those are specified in the thread. Good luck if you decide to enter!

[b][color=white][u]Member Feedback Threads[/u][/color][/b]

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5292406][b]big dick rick's 2000 post feedback thread[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2959395][color=#99FF00][b]big dick rick[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]big rick dick is known as a member of outstanding quality on Hack Forums. He has created a very detailed feedback thread that offers an immense amount of value to all of us. Take note of what this member does and strive to be more like him. Check his thread out!

[b][color=white][u]Miscellaneous[/u][/color][/b] 

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5302654][b]Guys, Im getting turnt[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2135886][color=#00AAFF][b]￼Google Chrome￼[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]The member Google Chrome will indulge in extreme savagery and get intoxicated by eating flavored mousse that contains alcohol. Let's hope he doesn't damage his liver too much.

[b][color=white][u]Note from Cin[/u][/color][/b] 
Please report any threads you enjoy or find to be informational on our [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5264513]weekly reports[/url] thread to make it easier for journalists to do their jobs.

[color=transparent]       [/color]


[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v2/Interview.png[/img]
[align=center][b][i]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878]Clique[/url][/i][/b][/align]
[spoiler=][align=left][url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FF69B4][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url] Welcome to this weeks edition of the HF news. We're joined with Glitch. Any shoutouts before we begin?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=55709][color=white][b]Glitch:[/b][/color][/url] Thanks for having me! I guess shoutout to my bro Shahanshaha. Not many people know of him, so show him love. Prada, Zexo, Reset, Realizm, iHydra, you're all awesome. Also Fiber/Grin/Clark/Hex (all RIP). I guess I'll shout you out too, Clique!

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FF69B4][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url]  Damn, quite a list. Thanks for the shoutout! How'd you even find out about HF in the first place?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=55709][color=white][b]Glitch:[/b][/color][/url]  So it started all the way back when I was playing flash games. I was looking for a way to hack my stats really high, and so I downloaded Cheat Engine and signed up sometime late 2008. I'm not sure the exact process that went down, but I'm pretty sure after a few months there, I saw something about Hack Forums and decided to visit / sign up. I know I was on HF before that, but I remember I got annoyed that you needed to register to see or do anything so I refused to sign up at first. I caved in April '09, and I'm pretty glad I did. My intentions were all over the place in the beginning. I was just fascinated by computers and technology in general. From hacking stats in flash games, to developing trainers in C#, down to creating "Random Spam Programs" with batch files. I just enjoyed all aspects of technology and HF had a lot to offer back in the day.

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FF69B4][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url] Do you think HF has changed over the years?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=55709][color=white][b]Glitch:[/b][/color][/url] Yea I do. It used to be primarily about hacking and development and nowadays it seems more like a place to lounge and discuss technology. I miss the old HF when groups were more interactive and had a real purpose. I hope to bring that back in a way but I understand the site has shifted it's focus. Perhaps someday there will be a return of the hacking culture that I remember.

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FF69B4][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url]  Do you think groups are moving in the right direction?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=55709][color=white][b]Glitch:[/b][/color][/url] I think they're better than last year that's certain. The marketing phase killed all but a slimmer of faith, but it seems like they're assimilating to the new culture now with groups like Echo and Sheepgang. I don't think that's a bad thing really. I like it more than the groups trying to force an elite attitude with their absurd buy-ins and whatnot.

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FF69B4][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url]   For sure. What's the meaning behind your username? Is this your only alias?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=55709][color=white][b]Glitch:[/b][/color][/url] I develop a lot. It's my full time job. So I just kind of picked a name that related to me a bit, and I'm constantly fixing glitches in code so it seemed like something that fit. Back in the day I used to go by Revenger on a bunch of other sites, but that name grew old to me, so I don't use it anymore.

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FF69B4][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url]  True shit. What do you do besides developing?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=55709][color=white][b]Glitch:[/b][/color][/url] Well, I listen to a lot of music and rap. I'm a bit obsessed with words and tend to write for hours whenever I have free time. Other than that, I like to work. Everything I do is usually work. I don't play many games these days. I just enjoy developing applications and seeing them come to life.

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FF69B4][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url] That's pretty dope. How's your new forum coming along? Still getting a decent amount of activity?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=55709][color=white][b]Glitch:[/b][/color][/url]  It's coming. We have a few people participating more than others, and each week we get another member to a few new members so it's still moving. I don't expect anything for a while. Communities take a while to grow.

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FF69B4][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url] Any tips for people wanting to start their own forum?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=55709][color=white][b]Glitch:[/b][/color][/url]  The main thing I would say is dedication. Too many people give up after the first couple months or year. If you want to have a successful forum, expect to put in a lot of time for it.

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FF69B4][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url] Thanks for taking to time to do this interview with me, any final words before we're finished?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=55709][color=white][b]Glitch:[/b][/color][/url]  Thanks for having me, and remember guys- make HF great again!
[/align]
[/align]
[/spoiler]

[color=transparent]       [/color][/size][/font]
posts.subject: Hack Forums News // Edition 295

Shoutout to my buddy [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1104007]AXiS[/url], it's his 19th birthday today, June 15th.  Happy birthday man, enjoy it.

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v2/WorldNews.png[/img][/align]
[align=center][b][i]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2110841]Night Fury[/url][/i][/b][/align]

[url=http://www.reuters.com/article/us-olympics-rio-superbacteria-exclusive-idUSKCN0YW2E8?feedType=RSS&feedName=topNews&utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=Social][b][color=white]Rio's Olympic Venues contaminated with "Super Bacteria" [/color][/b][/url]
The discovery of an extremely harmful bacteria in Rio has raised concern among scientists. According to their reports, they have found this dangerous bacteria where rowing and canoe athletes plan to compete this August. This bacteria, classified as an urgent public health threat by the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), is proven to exist on five of Rio's showcase beaches. Studies conducted by the CDC have shown nearly a 50% mortality rate upon interaction with the microbe. The proliferation of bacteria is attributed to the poor sewage systems in Brazil, but the local government has dismissed the concern.  

[url=http://www.smithsonianmag.com/smart-news/vandals-destroyed-8000-year-old-aboriginal-artworks-in-tasmania-180959328/?no-ist][b][color=white]8,000-Year-Old Aboriginal Artwork Destroyed by Vandals in Tasmania[/color][/b][/url]
Millenia-old historical artwork in the Nirmena Nala rock shelter met its demise in mere minutes. The Aboriginal artwork was determined to have been scratched so severely by vandals that it is beyond repair. Many Tasmanian Aboriginals viewed the site as sacred and of cultural importance. To add insult to injury, the vandalism was discovered the day before Sorry Day: Sorry Day is a national day of remembrance for the mistreatment that Aboriginals received from early European immigrants. Tasmanian police are investigating the vandalism in hopes of finding a culprit.

[url=http://www.msn.com/en-us/money/markets/china-plans-massive-sea-lab-10000-feet-underwater/ar-AAgNNMi?li=BBnbfcL][b][color=white]China Reveals Plans for Undersea Lab[/color][/b][/url]
In the interest of mineral extraction and military strategy, China plans to build a lab 10,000 feet below sea level in the South China Sea. The idea is near the top of China's agenda, and efforts are being made to accelerate implementation. Submersible watercraft have reached those depths before, but nothing long-term has even been attempted at such extreme depths. The South China Sea has become a point of contention among many nations in recent years. With major resource reserves and shipping lanes in the area, China has increased its efforts for further control of the waterway.

[color=transparent]   [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v2/TechNews.png[/img][/align]
[align=center][b][i]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2776397]Young Thug[/url][/i][/b][/align]

[color=white][url=http://www.pcmag.com/news/345172/lenovo-shows-off-bendable-phones-tablets/][b]Lenovo reveals bendable phones and tablets[/b][/url][/color]

Ever since Samsung rumored their "flexible phone" three years ago, people have wondered: "Is it possible to make a phone that bends, yet still functions?"  This past week Lenovo showed two of their latest attempts to answer this question: the CPlus, and the Folio, a bendable phone, and a bendable tablet.  The CPlus has multiple hinges inside that allow it to be worn as a bracelet.  In "bracelet mode" the screen transitions into three sections to display all that it would normally.  "At the company's Tech World Expo in San Francisco, Chief Technology Officer Peter Hortensius said there are two main engineering obstacles to overcome. First, Lenovo's focus groups have shown that people want to interact with the phone or tablet when it's folded."  The second problem Lenovo is trying to overcome is where to put the memory, camera, and processor.  Lenovo is working diligently to solve these problems with prototype after prototype, and get these flexible devices onto the market in the next few years.


[color=white][url=http://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2016-06-10/amazon-said-to-discuss-stand-alone-music-service-with-labels][b]Amazon determined to create stand-alone music service[/b][/url][/color]

Amazon Prime comes with a music streaming service, but customers have not been happy with it, and still resort to services such as Spotify.  Amazon has said they are set out to strike deals with record labels, and get some big name artists on their service. The service would cost $9.99 a month, and would be set to compete with services such as Spotify or Pandora.  Amazon refused to comment on the service when questioned, leading reporters to believe it's all in the developmental stages at this time.  It is believed Amazon aims to integrate this service into their Echo device, which offers in-home music streaming.


[color=white][url=http://www.nbcnews.com/tech/tech-news/tesla-says-there-no-safety-defect-its-model-s-or-n589496/][b]Lack of safety detect may lead to Tesla recall[/b][/url][/color]

"Tesla said on Friday there was no safety defect in its Model S or Model X, and that the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) had not opened any investigation or any "preliminary evaluation" on the matter."  A problem in the Model S' suspension has been discovered: a possible defect in the suspension control arms may cause them to break, leading to the driver losing control of the vehicle.  The NHTSA said on Thursday that it will begin to look into the matter, gathering reports and analytics on the car from Tesla, and current owners.  Tesla stands by their claim that there is no defect, but if it does exist, it would mean a mass recall on Tesla's part.  Tesla also stated that there was a routine screening run on the suspension by the NHTSA in April, and they asked for no further info.  For now, owners wait with bated breath in hopes that the rumors of a defect are disproven.

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v2/GamingNews.png[/img][/align]
[align=center][b][i]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2364291]Buffy Summers[/url][/i][/b][/align]

[url=https://www.theguardian.com/technology/gallery/2016/jun/09/e3-2016-our-16-most-anticipated-games][color=white]The Most Anticipated Games of E3![/color][/url]
E3 is mere days away and it is sure to inspire amazement among video game fanatics around the globe. There are highly anticipated titles that have been confirmed and rumors that have fans waiting with baited breath. Starting with the former, there are some big hitting titles confirmed to make an appearance at E3. The developers of the Fallout series, Bethesda, will be showcasing their latest title, Dishonored 2. It is speculated to get most of the screen time during Bethesda's conference as it is their biggest upcoming title this year. There is plenty of information to be found online regarding the first-person stealth game. However, there aren't many gameplay videos to be found. This is expected to change once their conference wraps up. Electronic Arts will be bringing more of Battlefield 1 to the table. They released another [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qW12ekqPUOU]snippet[/url] of their trailer today which highlights anti-tank dynamite -- a cool, new, flashy gameplay mechanic. More footage will be broadcasted tomorrow, June 12, during their conference. If that isn't enough, EA will also livestream a 64-player match with the likes of Snoop Dogg and Whiz Khalifa signed up to take part! Following the success of Life is Strange, Dontnod Entertainment will be showcasing their newest game, Vampyr. Vampyr's [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=18tlnN_EQQc]trailer[/url] was released ahead of time and showcased some combat. Combat is comprised of melee and shooting, along with supernatural vampiric abilities. We'll see what else is to come of Vampyr in just a few days. Quantic Dream's heavily request game, Detroit: Become Human, will also show its face at E3. For those that aren't familiar, Quantic Dream released a [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j-pF56-ZYkY]tech demo[/url] that was so emotional and powerful that thousands upon thousands of people wanted it turned into a game. They got their wish. Not much is known about the game, but that will change this upcoming Monday during Quantic Dream's presentation. Now for the rumors. Resident Evil 7 is expected to make an appearance this E3 and the newly announced remake of Resident Evil 2 will join it if we're lucky. Capcom has stated that their projects are making steady progress, but their current states are unknown. The studio also claims that Resident Evil 7 will also return to its survival roots after the disappointment that Resident Evil 6 happened to be. The Last of Us 2 isn't confirmed to make an appearance at E3, but many speculate that it will show up since an [url=http://static2.hypable.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/The-Last-of-Us-2.jpg]Easter egg[/url] recently showed up in Uncharted 4. Naughty Dog is rumored to have much up its sleeve this week. News will be dropped left and right in the upcoming days. Stay tuned for next week's article. There will be much to talk about!

[url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/technology/2016/06/10/new-ps4-neo-with-4k-graphics-confirmed-by-sony/][color=white]PS4.5/Neo Confirmed![/color][/url]
The rumors were true! Sony's president and group CEO, Andrew House, has confirmed that they have been working on an updated model of the PS4. The PS4 was released just two and a half years ago, but is not able to render games in 4K, the ultra high-definition video format adopted by many TV manufacturers. The update will change this. The updated model will not serve as a replacement of the original PS4, but will sit alongside it. House state that all games will support the standard PS4 and that he anticipates all or a very large majority of games will also support the high-end PS4. Unfortunately, there won't be any news regarding the updated PS4 at E3 which leads me to believe that it won't be released until 2017.

[url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/ps4-exclusive-horizon-zero-dawn-delayed-until-2017/1100-6440491/][color=white]Horizon: Zero Dawn Delayed Until February 2017[/color][/url]
Guerilla Games recently announced on the Playstation Blog that Horizon: Zero Dawn has been delayed. It won't be released until February 28 of next year. Managing director, Herman Hulst, stated that it was a very difficult decision to make, but it was one that had to be made. He claimed that Guerilla Games wants to ensure that Horizon Zero Dawn lives up to the visuals and gameplay quality that their games are known for. The new date will afford them the extra time required to deliver fully on their ambitious vision for Horizon: Zero Dawn. Horizon: Zero Dawn is ambitious in its intent which explains the need for more time to create a polished product. The game will feature a complete day and night cycle, changing weather, and a beautiful environment. The open world will mostly consist of forests and mountains, but also feature "atmospheric ruins of a bygone civilization". The stunning combat against mechanized dinosaurs in Horizon: Zero Dawn appears intricate, engaging, and fun. Guerilla Games released a new trailer that showcases the game's beauty which can be viewed [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u4-FCsiF5x4]here[/url]. The combat is also featured in the newest trailer. Despite its delay, pre-orders are now live. Pre-orders feature various DLC goodies, an artbook, a steelcase, and, most noteworthy, a nine-inch statue of the game's protagonist, Aloy.

[align=center]Gaming Video of the Week[sp]

[yt]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x0jR6sxG-ps[/yt][/sp][/align]

[color=transparent]     [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v2/HackingNews.png[/img][/align]
[align=center][b][i]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=4413]Phіus[/url][/i][/b][/align]

[url=http://thehackernews.com/2016/06/vk-com-data-breach.html][b][color=white]Vk.com Database Breach[/color][/b][/url]
Vk.com, currently the biggest social network in Russia has recently been breached by the hacker who is also responsible for the MySpace, Tumblr, and LinkedIn hacks that have surfaced not so long ago. Vk's database consists of over 100 million records including full names, phone numbers, email addresses, and surprisingly plain-text passwords. Apparently they were never encrypted to begin with, which simplified things for the hacker and increased the value of the database. Copies of the database are currently being sold for one Bitcoin which at the time of writing is valued at $581.9

[url=http://www.ehackingnews.com/2016/06/mark-zuckerbergs-social-media-accounts.html][b][color=white]Mark Zuckerburg's Social Media Accounts Hacked[/color][/b][/url]
Guilty of reusing passwords across multiple platforms, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerburg was a victim of the LinkedIn database dump, which allowed a group named OurMine to gain access to his Twitter, Instagram, and Pinterest accounts which were, as expected, quickly recovered.

[url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/calgary/university-calgary-ransomware-cyberattack-1.3620979][b][color=white]Canadian University pays $20,000 ransom to Hacker[/color][/b][/url]
The University of Calgary in Alberta was a victim of a ransomware infection which spread across it's student and staff computer systems. This strain of malware encrypts files throughout a computer and demands a ransom fee in exchange for the decryption of the affected files. After a failed attempt to decrypt the documents on their own, the university was trusting enough to pay the hacker 20,000 CAD in order to regain access to their files which were successfully decrypted after the payment was carried out.

[color=transparent]       [/color][/size][/font]

[font=Trebuchet MS][size=1][color=transparent]       [/color]
[align=center][size=large][b][color=#89dce1]Spotlight[/color] [color=white]•[/color] [color=#e15555]Trends[/color] [color=white]•[/color] [color=#e0d858]Comics[/color] [color=white]•[/color] [color=white]HF News Team[/color][/b][/size][/align]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v2/Spotlight.png[/img][/align]
[align=center][b][i]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239]iHydra[/url][/i][/b][/align]

[align=center][size=x-large][color=white][font=Monotype Corsiva][i]Northern Lights[/i][/font][/color][/size]
[img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v2/Spotlight295-Photo.png[/img]
by [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=790312][color=#00aaff]whoyodaddy[/color][/url][/align]

[align=center]Do you deserve a spot on here? PM iHydra with a good reason and let's get you on the spotlight![/align]
[color=transparent]         [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v2/Trends.png[/img][/align]
[align=center][b][i]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131]Ariana[/url][/i][/b][/align]

[url=http://www.cnn.com/2016/06/03/us/muhammad-ali/][b][color=white]Justin Bieber: Street Brawl[/color][/b][/url]
After attending Game 3 of the NBA finals in Clevland, Justin Bieber, got into a little beef with a man by the name of Lamont Richmond. TMZ states that the 22 year old popstar singer incited the 6'5 man by calling Richmond a "motherf*****".  It is unclear if this is what actually started the fight and has not yet been confirmed, but a seventeen second video was recorded from a bystander of what shows the teen popstar "getting his ass kicked" as the caption of the video says. You can check out that video by clicking [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r-4oGYvlyaM]here[/url]. Soon after the Bieber fight video surfaced, Lamont Richmond had posted a video on Facebook explaining his side of the story, but the video was taken down a few minutes later. In the video, Richmond said, "For all you people talking crap he started with me I was just walking with my girlfriend both of them. They asked the little guy can they take a picture with him he said hell no get out his face so I said what the hell wrong with you. Then he threw a punch and you see from the video what I had to do." The seventeen second video was captured inside of the hotel where Bieber had been staying at the time. Is it too late for the singer to say sorry?

[url=http://thenextweb.com/insider/2016/06/09/paypal-wont-refund-twitch-trolls-50000-in-donations/][b][color=white]PayPal Won't Refund Twitch Troll's $50,000 in Donations[/color][/b][/url]
A Twitch stream troll by the name of, iNexus_Ninja, is going to feel sorry after what he/she thought was going to be a funny prank. Everyday popular Twitch streamers receive donations ranging from different amounts. Anywhere from $10 all the way to $10,000 people find ways to giveback and show support to some of their favorite streamers. It all started with Hearthstone streamer, LegendaryLea, who had gotten a $250 donation from iNexus_Ninja, the Twitch stream troll. Soon after the first donation, iNexus_Ninja later decided he/she would send more money to Lea, which averaged to around $11,500 in the end. Happy with joy, Lea danced around the room thanking the generous user for the money she had just received. After trolling around with Lea, iNexus_Ninja decided to donate to a few other popular streamers on Twitch. The list includes, NoSleepTV, Sodapoppin and Dizzykitten where iNexus_Ninja had donated over $50,000 in total. After donating the large sum of cash, iNexus_Ninja's intentions were to just cancel the payment and be refunded the money back. Ninja was soon later identified as Anthony Archer, an eighteen year old from Australia. The eighteen year old had tried to chargeback the money but was greeted with the terms of service page by PayPal after finding out that the money used was from Archer's parents credit cards. The PayPal team noticed the scheme that was going on and declined the chargebacks stating that, "knowingly donating and changing your mind" is not  included in the Buyer Protection program PayPal has to offer. In nicer words, this was a FU to Archer and his evil plans.

[url=http://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/voice-alum-christina-grimmie-shot-orlando-concert-critical/story?id=39774979][b][color=white]'The Voice' Singer Christina Grimmie Dies After Being Shot at Orlando Concert[/color][/b][/url]
Former singer and performer of The Voice in 2014, Christina Grimmie, was shot and killed in Orlando, Florida. The tragic incident happened right after Grimmie's performance which sources say occurred around 10:30 P.M. at the Plaza Live theater. Christina Grimmie had posted a video on Snapchat informing fans that she would be hosting a meet and greet where she would be singing autographs and taking pictures with fans. A male suspect, identified as Kevin James Loibl, walked in on the autograph signings, approached Christina, and opened fire. Christina's brother, Marcus, tackled the suspect to the floor to prevent any more harm being done. Soon after the shooting took place, the gunman shot and killed himself. Christina was rushed to the hospital in critical conditions and soon died the next day. Police reported that the suspect had two hand guns with both magazines loaded and a knife on him. Marcus Grimmie was proclaimed as a hero, in which the Police stated that without the help of him, the shooter may have done more damage and most likely would have killed other civilians. The police do not know the motive of the shooter and currently state that he had no relations to Christina. The 22 year old singer, well known for being the biggest "YouTube Cover Girl", became a hit in 2009 back when she was only sixteen years of age going by the username "zeldaxlove64". After managing to blow up in popularity, the young and energetic singer had the chance to meet other well known YouTube musicians such as Sam Tsui where the two released a cover of Nelly's "Just A Dream". In 2013 she was the 4th most subscribed musician on YouTube. After releasing a cover of Miley Cyrus' "Party in the U.S.A", a celebrity talent agency by the name of LH7 Management were astonished by the performance. Brian Teefey who is the step-father of Selena Gomez was the manager that had reached out to Grimmie saying she had potential and was very talented. Brian could not believe believed how musically enhanced Grimmie was at such a young age. In 2011, Christina Grimmie had the chance to be a backup singer for Selena Gomez. The two became best friends and soon enough, Selena became Christina's mentor. In 2012, Christina decided to move to Los Angeles where she wanted to pursue a career in singing. Soon after moving, she released her very first album titled, "With Love" in 2013. One of Grimmie's newest accomplishments was being a singer and performer on hit TV show The Voice where she competed against some of the top singers in America.
